incidents.name: Errors When Attempting to Manage Payment Method

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved the issues with managing payment methods in the SendGrid interface. From 1:00 PM PST Oct 2nd to 1:00PM PST Oct 3rd, a very small portion of customers may have experienced errors when attempting to add or update their payment method. The issue has been resolved, and all impacted services are operating normally.

incidents.name: Connectivity Timeouts to US East SendGrid Region

incident_updates.body: Beginning 12:00 PM PT on September 28, 2023, our engineers confirmed that connectivity began to fail for API calls made to api.sendgrid.com for a subset of users. This issue affected mail send as well as user interface web console functionality for the SendGrid platform. This only affected users which connected through the United States East Coast region to api.sendgrid.com. It was determined that one of the connectivity points within the region for api.sendgrid.com was unable to accept API traffic which was causing the API connections to fail. This connectivity point was fixed at 12:54 PM PT, and this change allowed new connections to successfully use api.sendgrid.com from the region. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are now operating normally.

incidents.name: Intermittent Failed Subuser Creation

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with creating subusers has been resolved. Subusers that previously failed to create have been retried by our systems and recreated. All services are now operating normally at this time.

Our teams are still monitoring the fix that was implemented. Engineers are also working on retrying subusers that previously failed to create. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Users should no longer see subusers fail to create. Subusers that previously failed to create will be retried by our systems. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. Users should no longer see subusers fail to create. Subusers that previously failed to create will be retried by our systems. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers have identified the issue and are working toward a fix. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 7:44 AM PT, our Engineers began investigating an issue with subuser creation. At this time, customers may see subusers fail to create via the API even when receiving a 2xx level response from the API. We will provide another update on this issue within an hour or as soon as more information is available.

incidents.name: Two Factor Authentication Redirection Problems for Free Users

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the fix and confirmed the issue with Two-Factor Authentication redirection problems for Free users has been resolved. All systems are operating as expected at this time.

The issue was identified and our Engineers implemented a fix. As a way to mitigate any errors we suggest clearing cache and cookies, as this proved to be a way to avoid the infinite Two Factor Authentication redirection issue. We will provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.
Our engineers are completing validation steps to confirm possible solutions. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the potential cause of the infinite Two Factor Authentication redirection for "Free" accounts. Validation steps are being taken to confirm possible solutions. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting at 4:08 PM PT on September 26, 2023, our engineers began investigating a problem in which some SendGrid users are unable to properly login using Two Factor Authentication to their respective SendGrid accounts. Only a subset of customers are affected and only those with "Free" pricing packages are included in this group. When affected account users try to login, they will experience an infinite redirection loop when attempting to login using the Two Factor Authentication error. This incident does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers deployed a change to the internal settings for sender verification, selected IBM resellers customers should now be able to send emails via API and SMTP.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Errors When Using SendGrid API and User Interface Systems

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have monitored the deployed fix and confirmed the problems with the data center have been resolved. All services are operating normally at this time.

Our engineering team deployed a change to the internal system associated with the data center that was affected with the aforementioned errors. The deployment occurred at 3:55 PM PT and this change showed health improvements in functionality of non-mail send API and user interface resources for the affected SendGrid systems. After this deploy, both API and user interface errors are showing to be reduced. We are continuing to monitor for stability over the next hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 2:38 PM PT on August 24th, our engineers began investigating an issue with errors being reported with one of our data centers. Users may experience timeouts and server errors when connecting the SendGrid API or using the user interface via app.sendgrid.com. This includes errors when trying to access the SendGrid login page as well as API responses including 5XX type errors and "internal server error" with valid request information. This did impact mail send for both web API and SMTP, but a deploy was made at 2:45 PM PT to fix the delays in mail sending.  Problems with the user interface as well as other non-mail send API connectivity is still being investigated. We will provide another update in an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SendGrid Email Validations API Unavailable

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 1:13 PM PT on June 1st, our engineering team began investigating a problem related to SendGrid Email Validations API. Our team determined that this issue began at 10:13 AM PT and lasted through 1:29 PM PT, at which point a deploy was made to fix the problem. During the affected period, the SendGrid system began producing failures for attempts made to the Email Validations API endpoint for SendGrid. Users accessing this feature would have seen "403 FORBIDDEN" API response errors despite having proper permissions and feature access to this API endpoint. This did not impact mail send.  This issue has been resolved and systems are now operating normally.

incidents.name: Mail Send Delays

incident_updates.body: Beginning at 10:17 AM PT on May 31st, our engineering team began investigating a problem related to mail send delays for a subset of our users. The period of time for delayed mail send was between 9:50 AM PT and 11:50 AM PT, at which point mail successfully and completely dequeued from the system. This delay affected mail sent via SMTP, web API and Marketing Campaigns and affected approximately 20% of customer accounts. For any affected messages, the average queue time was approximately 5 minutes for the period. This issue has been resolved and mail sending systems are now operating normally.

Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in 1 hour, or as soon as more information becomes available.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.

Our engineering team has identified the issue and are working towards a fix. Only stats for events occurring after 4:30 PM PT on May 23rd are impacted. We will provide another update within an hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 7:00 A.M. PT on May 24, our engineers started investigating delays with Global Stats. Customers may experience delays for the posting of stats. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Event Data Loss

incident_updates.body: Our engineers have investigated and resolved identified issues surrounding event data loss. From April 21st 1:30 PM PST to April 24th 11:00 AM PST, approximately 0.08% of event data was lost. The event data includes all delivery events such as Processed, Delivered, Bounces and Blocks. The data lost during this time period is unrecoverable. This includes data within Stats, Email Activity, Expert Insights and the Event Webhook. The issue has been resolved and all impacted services are operating normally.

Our engineers believe this issue is resolved and all customers can now access invoices from within the SendGrid account interface as expected. We'll continue to monitor and provide another update within 30 minutes.

incidents.name: Intermittent Mail Processing Delays and Timeouts

incident_updates.body: From 08:45 AM PDT to 09:05 AM PDT on March 23, 2023, we experienced an issue that may have affected processing times, and may have also resulted in connection time-outs to our servers. Potential impacts to users may include those that utilize the parseapi feature, as well as some "Forward Bounce" information.  Our engineers were able to quickly identify the issue and deploy a fix, and all systems are operating normally at this time. If you experienced degradation in service during this window, please contact Support.

incidents.name: Issues with Event Webhook for a small set of users

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working towards a fix. We expect to provide another update as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working towards a fix for the users not receiving event data via the Event Notification Webhook.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our engineers have identified the issue and are working towards a fix for the users not receiving event data via the Event Notification Webhook.  We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 4:10PM PST on March 21st, 2023, our engineers began investigating an issue with the Event Notification Webhook. A small set of around 40 users are not receiving event data via the Event Notification Webhook. This does not impact mail send, nor does it impact data sent to the Email Activity Feed. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Monitoring: Our engineers have implemented a fix and are monitoring system performance. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Starting around 11:58 PT on Monday 03/20/2023, our engineers began investigating an issue with the SendGrid website. Users may experience intermittent issues with new account signups, account upgrades, and menu options on the website not loading correctly upon logging in. As a current workaround for this issue, refreshing the web browser used to access the site will allow the site to load fully. This does not impact mail send. We will provide another update in one hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
